patterns_discovered.consistent_url_building: Gemini uses API key as query parameter rather than header
patterns_discovered.provider_specific_preservation: Request/response conversion and API error checking maintained
patterns_discovered.error_handling_consistency: Error propagation unchanged with same wrapping and messages
patterns_discovered.import_cleanup: Automatic removal of unused imports after HTTP logic centralization

gotchas_discovered.api_key_placement: Gemini requires API key in URL query parameter, not Authorization header
gotchas_discovered.model_prefix_handling: Model names need 'models/' prefix for Gemini API URLs
gotchas_discovered.provider_validation: Must preserve provider-specific validation logic (safety blocks, empty candidates)

approach_outcome.centralization_achieved: HTTP request handling now uses doHTTPRequest helper

next_steps: Run Gemini client tests to verify no regressions
optimization_opportunities: Consider similar refactoring for other Gemini methods if they exist
recommendations.best_practice_observed: Maintain provider-specific logic while centralizing common HTTP patterns
recommendations.lessons_learned: Small line reductions (31%) add up significantly across multiple provider refactors
